Resident
2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/01/2017
The property is conveniently located (grocery store close-by, school, highway access). The area is pretty quiet and safe. Maintenance staff does a great job (very fast). Managment is very poor. There are too many people working in the office at Lenox; so if there is a problem no one feels responsible. Trash at the trash disposal is always piling up. The charge of more than $40 is not justified for this. Overall it's a decent place to live, not luxurious as advertised, and poorly managed.

Report
Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/31/2017
I just moved into my place 2 weeks ago and I LOVE the apartment, the community, and the rental staff. I moved from a townhome and was skeptical of the community at first until I met Julian in the rental office. He was professional, prompt, nice, but most importantly he was honest and real with me regarding the Lenox community. I love getting off of work and walking my dog in the beautiful community. The pool, gym, public park, nearby schools, nearby shopping, and office area to study is a great asset. There are many communities one can reside in Durham, but overall, this is the best that I've experienced and you can take that from me, Paul Weaver.

Report
Resident
2016 - 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 03/16/2017
Here's our honest experience w/Lenox. We came right after the transition from old management, & lots of swapping arounds/new hires. Move-in was HORRENDOUS & our transition from another state wasn't pleasant or at ease. Our apt was not move in ready in the least & after many hours of cleaning & crying LOL, it became live able. We still have over spray over our entire apt & missed areas, entire ceiling. Our counter tops were painted black &bubble crack & the sink/counter top doesn't line up, Very tacky looking. Dishwasher is so loud we cannot run ours during the day, can't hear over it, kids nap or our bedtime. So we always have to try to time it correctly when we leave the house. Very inconvenient & have tried multiple times getting that fixed. I have even requested a new dishwasher, but not even a motor fix & I put that request in 4.5 weeks ago(for the 3rd time since move in) w/several follow ups. Fridge is loud as well. Although it's been over 5 months things still need to be fixed. I have to be honest, MOST order requests are still very DELAYED. I finally gave up asking because it was more frustrating constantly putting in the same requests w/following up. Always respectfully I felt. Now we only request things that have to do with the functioning of the apt. I am not blaming any maintanence men as I truly believe "you can't blame the server for the chef's mistakes". Matt and Paul are great at their part of the job. When they come and fix or do work they are conversational, quick, & very thorough with their work & if any mistakes they happily come back to help you out. A lot more gets done when you go DIRECTLY to Matt or Paul, but it isn't their job to have to manage the tenants. That puts so much on them when they have hundreds of other tenants to care for. HIGH ELETRICITY! We pay double the amount that we paid in our townhouse in CALIFORNIA. We called Duke and they said it's Lenox not them. We are not super conservative but we are more conservative then not if that makes sense. Low heat, low lighting, outlet usage,and even unplug wifi when not using. POSITIVES. I LOVE the windows. LOL They truly bring a lot of light in which is a big plus for apartment living. The grounds are kept nice. They finally have fixed the trash issues, now if tenants would learn the same courtesy & helping keep things clean(so don't blame Lenox for that). The building we live in we have great neighbors. very friendly, HELPFUL and yet keep to themselves. I've never been so pleased with neighbors & we also like the neighborhood. Quick walk through the back to shopping areas, food and Kroger. It is convenient to Downtown Durham, Chapel Hill, and not far from Cary and The airport! As for Luxury apts. I would say that doesnt hold true. The fitness center they provide isnt sufficient for a whole body workout & the equipment they do have is very old. Lots of things lacking for luxury. If they weren't luxury then I wouldn't be picky about some of these things. It's just the price you pay for the quality is pretty low, in our apt at least. I don't want to knock a place down, I only want to be honest so people have a choice knowing what they will be getting. We wouldn't choose this place again if we had the choice, unfortunately. The only way we would is if things drastically change in the next 5ish months of our lease term. I'm leaving you with..PROS summary about this place. WINDOWS, decent sized kitchen for apt living, neighbors, quiet & clean, & Matt & Paul for maintanence. I had to be honest & I hope this helps for future tenants!

Report
Resident
2013 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/08/2017
I have lived here for over 3 years now and have been very happy with the apartment complex. The complex has recently changed owners, and the new management has made some nice upgrades (e.g. new bbqs in the pool area, repaving the parking lots). The location is great, it is right next to the Patterson Place and New Hope Commons shopping centers, and almost equidistant between UNC-Chapel Hill and Duke. There is also a bus stop along the Triangle Transit Route 400 bus line (which runs between UNC-Chapel Hill and Duke) right outside the apartment complex. I feel this is also one of the much safer areas of Durham, and never felt uncomfortable about my safety in or around my apartment. The tenants consist of a nice mix of UNC and Duke graduate students, along with young professionals and families, and never had any issue with noise. The staff and maintenance all seem very friendly, and are generally attentive to requests. The only thing I can think of that might need upgrading is the exercise room (equipment is adequate but a little outdated). Definitely would recommend!

Report
Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/02/2017
I considered all other apartment complexes in the vicinity and selected Lenox at Patterson Place based on value, appearance, and safety. The signage has recently changed indicating that these are "luxury apartments." I think that the property is undergoing a facelift - that management is updating apartments as they become available. My studio is not updated, but it is clean, quiet and the overall feel of the complex is very welcoming and safe. There have been a few recent incidents with noise late at night and recycling/trash overflow, but management had taken steps to address before I had an opportunity to comment on the situation. The staff was also very helpful and accommodating during my application and in the few times I have had questions or needed assistance since. The few maintenance requests I had after move in were promptly addressed. The location is fantastic.

Report
Resident
2015 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 12/08/2016
Good points: Beautiful landscaping, location (easy access to I-40, UNC, Durham, shopping, restaurants); good floor plans; the property seems safe and doesn't have a lot of noisy people and cars coming and going. Bad points: trash is often overflowing on the weekend; need multiple requests for maintenance; no ceiling fans or overhead lights in the bedrooms; no linen closet or storage in bathrooms; and incredibly squeaky floors overhead. Management changed this year, and we were not informed in any way about this. I only found out by coming in to the office. Normally when this happens, the new management will put a flyer on each door. They also charge a pet rent where the former management did not, which was one of the reasons I selected this place originally. I have a philosophical objection to paying pet rent on top of a pet deposit! My rent has gone up by $150 since June 2015. They are marketing and pricing this complex as "luxury apartments" like the new ones down the street. These are not luxury apartments. The finishes on the cabinetry are cheap, appliances are outdated and noisy, and as mentioned, there are no ceiling fans or overhead lights in the bedrooms. I also have problems with maintenance - there's been several times over the past year and a half where I have requested maintenance and it has been ignored, or I needed to repeat the request more than once. Overall, I would recommend them but with some hesitation.

Report
Resident
2015 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/18/2016
I moved into Lenox about a year and a half ago when it was under different management. It was great, and still is pretty great. The management transition was rocky, some balls were dropped, such as lack of notification when entering the apartment to perform maintenance (this only happened once since new management took over this spring), and a claim that our rent was late when the receipts from previous management just hadn't been turned over. These issues have been corrected and things have been smooth for the most part. The landscaping is some of the best in the area, so it's pleasant when walking dogs or running. The inside of the apartments are clean and well-maintained. It's located near Kroger, which is perfect. Any time my roommate and I have had questions or concerns, they have responded with helpful advice and have met us with objectivity and kindness. They also tend to have pretty good deals on rent if you sign promptly. The only downsides are there's only one location for garbage for the entire complex, which is regularly overflowing, and the price. Typically apartments around here raise rent anywhere from 3-8% when resigning a lease, and Lenox has raised ours a consistent extra 115-125$ each time my roommate and I have resigned, which is more than a 10% hike. There's no guarantee about how much they will charge for rent when resigning (which is typical for most apartments anyways), so just sign for as long as you can to keep your rent price low.
I moved into Lenox about a year and a half ago when it was under different management. It was great, and still is pretty great. The management transition was rocky, some balls were dropped, such as lack of notification when entering the apartment to perform maintenance (this only happened once since new management took over this spring), and a claim that our rent was late when the receipts from previous management just hadn't been turned over. These issues have been corrected and things have been smooth for the most part. The landscaping is some of the best in the area, so it's pleasant when walking dogs or running. The inside of the apartments are clean and well-maintained. It's located near Kroger, which is perfect. Any time my roommate and I have had questions or concerns, they have responded with helpful advice and have met us with objectivity and kindness. They also tend to have pretty good deals on rent if you sign promptly. The only downsides are there's only one location for garbage for the entire complex, which is regularly overflowing, and the price. Typically apartments around here raise rent anywhere from 3-8% when resigning a lease, and Lenox has raised ours a consistent extra 115-125$ each time my roommate and I have resigned, which is more than a 10% hike. There's no guarantee about how much they will charge for rent when resigning (which is typical for most apartments anyways), so just sign for as long as you can to keep your rent price low. Prospective Resident
Visited 2016 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/10/2016
On August 31, 2016 I made a payment of $350 for my application fee, administrative fee and to place a hold on the third floor unit I was interested in. I was insured that my move in date would be on the 9/10/16. After a week of no communication, I called the office and never got a answer. Everytime I called the phone went to voicemail and no one ever called me back. I sent a email on September 6, 2016 to see what exactly was going on. Apparently, the person helping me was out on property but I got a emailed response from the apartments with no name attached explaining and I quote "the gentleman that is currently living in that unit and there is a possibility that he may not be vacating the unit due to his job keeping him here longer". Since that email was sent to me, everything has been a mess with very little communication so my father had to get involved. After paying another $100 for my fathers application to co-sign we were told AFTER our money was taken that he needs to be a home owner to cosign. So $100 was taken and wasted which could have been prevented if there was proper communication. This was very frustrating because his application clearly showed he was not a home owner. After his credit check was ran he was told he needs to have a total of five accounts open instead of the three he currently has. Since then my father has proceeded to open two more accounts and we still have heard nothing from anyone regarding this apartment. After a month of walking in circles with little to no communication, I decided enough was enough. I have found another apartment complex to live in. I contacted Lenox on October 6, 2016 to ask for my refund. I was ensured a email would be sent and it would take two weeks for corporate to cut the check. After contacting Lenox today I was informed there was no record of me making any payments EVER. Fortunately, I took a picture of the first cashiers check I gave them. This has been an expensive disaster that could have easily been avoided by the proper communication.

I happened to get my one bedroom apartment for a great rate, 660/month and leased oct 2015-nov 2016... if I hadn't gotten such a great rate I would be extremely unhappy with this place, but I would not reccomend this place to a friend know that the rates have shot up quite a bit. There are so many new apartment buildings popping up that there are such nicer facilities for the same rate that Lenox wanted me to sign to renew my lease. The gym is a joke. It's tiny and o oh semi comfortable to use if you're the only one in there. The printer in the conference room for the tenants to use never works. The pool only gets as deep as 4 feet and that is IF it's been refilled recently because in the summer the water level was going down. The trash does not get picked up nearly as often as it needs to and it always overflowing and getting super gross right next to the mailboxes. When I've needed assistance with my washing machine I was told it was fine but it was ruining my clothes. I have maintenance come for my washing machine 2 or 3 times and every time I was told nothing is wrong with it. I really loved the staff prior to the new owners took over early 2015. Not so impressed with them now. Also, my car got broken into twice living here and I thought maybe the staff should know, they didn't care and didn't have anything to say about it other than to call the police and let them handle it. They said there is 24 hour security here but if that's true, they just sit in the office all night because I have never seen any sort of security here. I don't know, I'm not pleased with this place but my rent was so cheap that I can't really complain.... but I wouldn't advise paying the new rates of nine hundred and something for what little they have to offer here.

2004 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/25/2015
This is a wonderful apt. complex. The grounds are lovely and kept up meticulously. The atmosphere is quiet & friendly. My neighbors have become dear friends and we look out for one another. The apt. is beautiful; has lots of light, space and charm. The staff is great: Amanda & Bradley are helpful, friendly & accessible. The Manager John is fantastic~ always there to address any concerns. Troy, Maintenance Supervisor, is top notch~ Reliable, Responsible, Trustworthy and an all around great guy! The location is completely central to Durham, Chapel Hill & RDU Airport. There is convenient shopping down the street- Kroger's, BB & B, Kohl's, Home Depot, etc. I-40 is minutes away as well as restaurants, wine stores & Straw Valley Food & Drink~ a great place to get coffee, wine & beautiful outdoor/indoor areas! I can't recommend this complex enough; it's a great value for the area. It's a very professional and family oriented vibe. This staff has been the best yet (I've seen many over the years!) in promoting community events and responding to residents' requests. There is a safe feel in that they have also organized around everybody watching out for the complex and each other... and great amenities; tennis courts, pool, business center, laundry on premises. There is ample parking, easy for guests and family to visit! I can't recommend Lenox at Patterson Place enough!

Resident
2010 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/23/2015
This is an all-around attractive property in the SW quadrant of Durham, NC--one that offers a desirable setting and amenities to families, graduate students, young professionals, and adults in life transitions alike. It is mostly quiet at all times of day and night, and is within just a couple minutes' drive of shopping and eating venues, as well as cultural and educational hubs such as UNC-CH, Duke, and NCCU. Overall, it has also been a very safe community, with low crime averages for each year. At present, John, Amanda, Brad and Troy are ably managing the property, and servicing the needs of its residents, who fill approximately 300 units. The landscaping is beautiful and meticulously manicured, especially in spring and summer, and the complex is a very walkable neighborhood, in propinquity to a city park that abuts a middle school. It is congenial to family living, and you will see a good many children here, but single med students, law students, and other graduate students find it comfortable too. Lenox is one of the more pricier properties in SW Durham, but if you value safety, well-appointed surroundings, nice apartment units, and amenities like a tennis court, pool, and clubhouse, the money is well spent. I definitely think you should give this property your due consideration as you contemplate your living arrangements.

Resident
2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 12/21/2013
When I first moved in, first impressions were not so good. When I first walked into my actual apartment, I was told to look around and see if anything was in need of attention. I noticed a few cracks on the outer layer of some of the walls around the apartment. Also, my bedroom door was hitting the frame and had to push really hard to shut it. They told me they would fix these issues on a Monday when I was working. I came back and they did absolutely nothing to fix the cracks and I'm not sure what they did to my door; it closes easier but still hits the frame. None of these minor problems about the apartment itself bothered me too much as I was more concerned about living here for the next year and not getting a good first impression (which is why I didn't press to get these fixed). They just better not take it out of my $300 deposit which I don't think they will. I have lived here for about 6 months now and overall I am pleased. It is a good price for the location but of course you aren't going to get granite counter tops or anything real high quality. I have had no bug problems which seems to be a big issue in some apartments (I used apartmentratings.com when looking for this one). There is no safety issues that I know of and I never have to drive more than a few miles to almost anywhere I need to go. My biggest issue with this place is, if you live on the bottom floor, there is noise. It sounds like there are elephants living above me. And sometimes I swear these elephants jump or fall over or something. I'm sure it is partially the residents fault because I will hear a bang like something is hitting the floor hard every now and then and I have no idea what they could possibly be doing up there. I would recommend getting the top floor if possible because you will hear every footstep and every movement from the bottom. In fact I can hear them as I am writing this. The only other small issue that I can think of is the outside maintenance guys. They are out there a lot which is fine (the grounds really do look great) but I will come home from work and my door mat will be 3 feet away from my door. Really? They blow the leaves off the porch and apparently anything else there and don't bother to put it back. It's really just inconsiderate but not a big deal. Overall, I would recommend Lenox, just know what you're getting into. In summary, great looking grounds, safe from what I can tell, nice staff, decent apartments, and good location at a fair price. Loses a star for the noise and another for ignoring my concerns when I first moved in. Otherwise I would give it 5. As of now, I would consider renewing my lease.

Verified Manager06/07/2013

Thank you for your feedback and for allowing us the opportunity to improve our services based on your comments. I truly am sorry that we have not met your needs and would like to be given a chance to correct that. Since this is anonymous, I am unable to reach out to you, but it would be wonderful if you could schedule a time to meet with me in the leasing office so we can put in service requests to fix any outstanding maintenance concerns you may have. If you prefer, I can meet you at your apartment with our service director to ensure we address all items. Since reading this review, I have met with the office staff to discuss with them the importance of not rushing through a conversation with any resident or prospective resident. While there are times when we will have several residents stop in, I do not want anyone to feel rushed or as though they are being intrusive. This will be a part of our continued training to make certain this does not happen again. I also would like to set a time to discuss your renewal options with you. We do value our residents and we pride ourselves as a company in having high renewal ratios. My hope is that through a meeting, we can come up with a mutually beneficial agreement. Lastly, I am very sorry for not providing advanced notice for the management change in the community. When a change of management happens, the new management company does not have access to the community until the day of the change. The first item on our agenda was to put notices of the management change as our introduction on every door, which we accomplished. We have also held a pizza party and a cupcake day in the clubhouse as a way to meet our residents. Besides our events, we do encourage all residents to feel welcome in the leasing office and to stop in so we can get to know you. I do encourage you to call the leasing office at (919) 401-1912 to set up a time to meet with me to resolve your concerns.

Resident
2013 - 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 11/23/2012
I've lived here for several years now and things have declined significantly since Connor Group began managing the property. I'm surprised to see all of the positive recent reviews, but the overwhelming majority of them seem to be from new tenants. We Lenox veterans have experienced WAY better management. Please note that the new sign states this is a luxury community, but it's far from that. Never has been. A comfortable community adjacent to a great shopping center with easy access to 15-501, but it is far from luxury. It takes more than a new sign with the word "luxury" on it to convert a community to that type of property. It takes Connor Group over 2 weeks to address minor maintenance issues. That's not luxury. Believe me, I know. At one point, Lenox was a decent value for the area, but - with the new price points - that's not longer true. Potential tenants can literally drive a couple of blocks up to pay the same price and live in a true luxury community. Don't be fooled by the (poorly designed) sign. You can get a better value elsewhere.

Resident
2010 - 2012 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/11/2012
I lived at the Lenox under both the old management and the new management, and was satisfied the entire time. I found the environment to be quiet and friendly. I felt safe going out for walks around the complex or sitting by the pool late at night (until new management padlocked the gate, so I couldn't get to the swing... sigh). The office staff were always friendly and helpful for me, and parallel parking (for our building) didn't bother me a bit. We never had noise problems (and we like it very quiet), and the grounds were always kept pretty and garbage-free. Overall, no real complaints. If I had to nitpick, I suppose the porches are quite small, The pet fee seemed quite high, and I wish that the transition from the old management to the new management had gone more smoothly (without jacking the prices!), but they did finally agree to let me lock in my old price if I agreed to sign on for another year... which I didn't, but wish now that I had, since Lenox was FAR BETTER than the place I'm stuck right now, practically next door.... I LOVED that Lenox was not a crappy college community. It housed young families and working professionals. Still, it's an apartment complex, and not truly a home... When we move out of our current place, we will be looking elsewhere for a more long-term home. Still, nothing but fond memories of Lenox. :)

Report
Resident
2010 - 2011 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/11/2012
I do not often feel the need to warn people when they are in danger. But with Lenox at Patterson Place, I feel an overwhelming sense of obligation to tell anyone out there who is reading this that you need to RUN AWAY! When I first moved into Lenox at Patterson Place, they were under management that allowed the woman working with me to waive certain things like security deposits, pet fees, application fees, etc. Lenox seemed like a reasonable group of individuals willing to work with my student budget. So when they told me I had until the end of the day to sign a contract for the low-rent apartment I wanted because they were running a special, I felt rushed a bit, but the deal seemed too good to turn down. I chose Lenox because of the price, amenities and people. I chose them for reasons such as the living rooms had a pretty ceiling fan, there was a laundry facility on the grounds and the people at Lenox seemed friendly and reasonable. However, when I moved in, the management had mysteriously changed. The apartment I moved into had not been cleaned since the last tenant lived there. It was disgusting. In the living room, where a ceiling fan should have been, there was a gaping hole with loose wires hanging down. The freezer s ice maker did not work and both toilets ran all the time. (I think that the maintenance people were very good and I do not believe any of the bad experiences I had were reflections of their lack of hard work.) I do believe that the new management was clueless. There continued to be some new face working in the office practically every month. Upon moving in, I was told to give repair requests through the website, which worked just fine for a while. Eventually, my requests were going unanswered and I thought maybe they were getting overlooked or ignored. I finally called the office and this new person informed me that repair requests were only being handled by phone. I feel obligated to report that, in the year I lived at Lenox, I never had a ceiling fan or overhead light in any room of my apartment. A small, round electrical cover was place of where a ceiling fan should have been. Each month, I was paying an absurd amount of money to Heartland Regional Power. This bill is the one that covers water, trash, sewer and pest control. I could limit my use of water as much as possible and my single-person bill was still at least $100 or more every month. Between the high costs and confusing fees, this bill was OUTRAGEOUSLY high every month. Under no circumstance would this ridiculous bill be considered reasonable to pay, but I definitely would have felt better paying this bill if the pest control was something I actually benefitted from. Unfortunately, I found multiple spiders and gnats in my apartment throughout the year. I was at my breaking point when I stepped out of bed and saw a roach run across the floor. In my time at Lenox, I ran into several roaches both in and out of my second floor apartment. Needless to say, I moved out. To my misfortune, I had to stay an extra 13 days past my lease until my next place was available. I was unable to negotiate any reasonable agreement for my month to month rent with the manager. I got suckered into paying day-by-day at a premium rent level. I would put up with this because I just could not wait to leave! So there I was, settled into a MUCH MUCH MUCH better place. Then, 130 days after I moved out of Lenox, I received a phone call from a collection agency for an outstanding balance I still owed. North Carolina State Landlord Tenant Act Article 6, Section 42-52 states that the landlord has 30 days to give the tenant notice of any outstanding balance. I NEVER received a letter, email, phone call, telegram, postcard, carrier pigeon or any other form of notification from Lenox regarding an obscenely unfair amount I owed to them. The matter is settled and behind me, after legal counsel, time and a lot of money. Bottom line: this place is unfair, unpleasant, unkempt and I hope that this review keeps other people from making the same mistake I did. Do NOT choose Lenox at Patterson Place.

2011 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/02/2011
Lenox at Patterson Place seemed to be an amazing place to move to. It's quiet, it's pretty, good location, etc. However, my nightmare started as soon as I signed my lease. Shortly after I signed my lease for my apartment I received a call from the lady that was in the leasing office saying that someone else wanted my apartment. Long story short, even after I had already given them my move in date I found out that my name was put on another lease for a different apartment. I started to receive calls about my water bill being over due for an apartment that I didn't live in (keep in mind that I did not live in the neighborhood at all at this time). For some crazy reason I still proceeded with moving into this neighborhood. Two weeks after I moved in paid everything that was due at the time. I get another call from the leasing office saying that my name was on a totally different lease and that I owed a ridiculous amount to them asap. So my name was on four different leases. Isn't that illegal? Ok... So let's get to the $80-$100 water bills. Not that you are using that much water. Your bill will show you that you have only used like $11 of water and sewage, the rest are fees that I am sure the leading office get a nice portion of. Need I say more? Oh yes, not to mention that the ladies in the office are completely rude and unprofessional. I once was told by one of the ladies in the office, to wait until she finished smoking her cigarette before she came in to collect not just my rent check but rent checks from three other people. And last but definitely not least. Yesterday at 7am I WALKED INTO THE COMPUTER LAB AT THE OFFICE ONLY TO FIND TWO ADULTS HAVING SEX ON THE FLOOR IN THE COMMUNITY COMPUTER LAB!!!!! SAVE YOUR MONEY, SAFETY, AND SANITY!! DONT MOVE HERE!!

Resident
2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/19/2011
OK before everyone screams that this is just management trying to save the image... I really DO live here and if it's that big of a deal I will post my apartment number for you to come prove it to yourself. The good: My apartment was clean, and everything looked good when i moved in. I havn't seen a coachroach or any yet (many places are overrun), the management is very nice to me (so far), the place is much safer than a lot of other places in this price range. I also got a very good deal on my apartment (or so i thought)... For what im paying, it seemed as though this was the perfect value. Safe, clean, very cheap for the location... The bad: Laundry facility on site, but none in the apartment unless you want to pay them extra per month for it (if you are going to do this, between heartland and the laundry fee you can go somewhere else much nicer for the same price) They WILL fine you for anything under the sun. Just follow the rules... if you leave garbage on your doorstep you will be fined before the end of the day. Dont drill holes in your walls, disable your smoke alarm, throw ridiculously loud parties, ect. Lets be honest, you know ahead of time before you move in if your planning on bending some rules... They will make you pay. If your rent is even one day late... you will pay a fine. Follow the rules and pay on time and you can avoid this. The garbage thing is constantly overflowing with trash. Looks bad but ive seen worse, and its far away form my unit. The ugly: Lenox at PP has an "agreement" with heartland... basically they "agreed" to force everyone who lives there to pay ridiculous bill for things that are included on 99% of apartments worldwide. When i asked why my water bill is 85 dollars instead of 20... they replied "oh no no, the heartland company covers water, sewer, trash, stormwater, and pest removal. Water: ok makes sense Sewer: usually included in water bill right? Stormwater: paying for the right to have a gutter? Trash: not a weekly doorstep pickup. You pay for the right to CARRY YOUR OWN TRASH to a community dumpster that is sometimes full. Pest Removal: ... your kidding right? Landlords get sued over pests in the house... never have i EVER heard of someone making you pay to remove the pest infestation from their apartment building. In fact, its ILLEGAL for them not to remove it. Basically they QUADRUPLE your bill and found some random things to add in (that are included everywhere else) WHY? you ask... We dont know... but i wouldn't be surprised to find out Lenox gets some sort of "kick-back" compensation for making them the company their residents have to use... Just a guess. BOTTOM LINE: It seems like a great deal... newer, nice apartments in a very good location at a good price. Once you factor in ridiculous heartland water bill.. it just becomes a fair value.. and if your miss some rent payments and throw parties... It will bankrupt you. I like living here and will continue to do so... PAY YOUR RENT, DONT TRHOW PARTIES, and ADD 65 DOLLARS TO THE RENT PRICE WHEN YOU COMPARE. Seriously there are much bigger concerns than a crazy bill at some cheaper apartments... however there are new options popping up everywhere. Look around I dont know if management knows this, but current residents are livid about the heartland bill and they are jumping ship... You will see a flood of people leaving this place soon and maybe rent will go down or something. There are tons of new options popping up around durham... Lets hope it puts enough pressure on them to fix this heartland situation.

anonymous 09/21/2011

Agree with the water bill--even if you live there only part of the month they take your average monthly bill and make you pay for an entire month even if like us we weren't even in the apartment. That is a total scam. electric bill--we moved from Raleigh from a 4 bedroom house-our bill here was the same amount for a 1 bedroom den on 2nd floor--so obviously poor insulation or inefficient system but plan on $100/month for electrical if you are a conservative user. Do not live by the pool--very noisy and parties all the time. Resident has to call the police as management does nothing. Trash overflowing at dumpsters was a problem all summer as was the recycle area where couches and junk remained sitting for weeks on end. Pet waste is becoming a problem that they don't seem to address even the lady in building 10 who simply lets her dog run out from the 1st floor apartment to poop and never cleans up and feeds all the stray cats on her porch by leaving out bowls of food. But they are polite staff, and there are bigger rip offs in the area (i.e. the Lennox at Patterson Place for instance) but just count on an extra $100-150 a month when doing your budget

Resident
2007 - 2011 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/15/2011
I moved into this complex when it was still owned by Equity, based on the location and price of rent. The neighborhood was quiet and the neighbors friendly. Once the complex was sold things went downhill quickly. The office staff changed every couple of weeks, and the tenants that began moving in were a stark contrast to the current residents I had grown fond of. I've had to report my new neighbors on many occasions for numerous reasons. Oh, and don't get me started on the water bill!! I'd paid $20-$25 monthly since moving in, and once the new group took over my water bill skyrocketed to $70-$75 every month, regardless of my efforts to conserve water. It's utterly ridiculous how much they are charging, I don't see how they're getting away with it. The pool is nice, but has been taken over by unruly kids, birthday parties, college students boozing it up ... a night and day difference from how pleasantly quiet and peaceful it used to be. I've spoken in depth with the new office manager, and she's assured me things are turning around and she's putting in the time and effort to get this community back to where it was when Equity was here. I truly hope so, because I used to love living here. Until I see the changes promised, I would not recommend this community to any of my friends/family.

Resident
2004 - 2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/15/2011
We've lived here for 7 years. We're on our third Management Company. Lenox is a wonderful location, situated in a convenient part of Durham and very close to Chapel Hill & Carrboro; having worked all 3 places, it's great here. It's only about 20 min. to airport. The apts are nice, the buildings are recently painted, the grounds are kept up and the office staff is very nice. Robin is the new manager and goes out of her way to be helpful and caring. They all work hard and are attentive. Maintenance staff is tops; Malcolm is the best! Very prompt and a down to earth nice guy! We've found it to be a safe place overall. We don't experience any noise issues, although we've always lived on top floor so nobody's above us. Before we moved here, we looked at other complexes; this was the nicest and less expensive than Chapel Hill (much more run down apts). The moving in Specials can be very good~ The rent does go up when you renew your lease; I imagine that's true most places. Heartland (water & sewer) is the downside. Their water, trash, sanitation & recycling fees are High! So just add $100 approximately to your rent. Our bill used to be more around $30. Sometimes they 'estimate' water usage, which is unfair especially if your life takes you out of town often. There must be a way they could establish a fairer rate. The tenants seem friendly; a very diverse population. My only beef w/ Lenox tenants is that folks don't always recycle or they throw garbage into recycling or cardboard/bottles into garbage. It takes so little effort to be conscientious. I have a feeling when they put stuff in the wrong place, it causes a lot of extra work for the staff/maintenance people. But, overall, I don't know of an apartment complex personally that I'd recommend over Lenox. We've been very content here.

This is the second time I've lived in a Connor Group-owned complex in the past 3 years. Quite honestly, the whole Heartland agreement is a drag... Connor Group is the ONLY company I've ever seen (in any state I've lived in) do anything like this. To tell the truth, if you told potential new residents about their water bill sooner (not after they sign the initial lease), you'd have a lot less people living here. All in all, I got a decent deal for my two bedroom. I wanted to live here because it's convenient to Walmart, Interstate 40, the driving range, and UNC campus where my girlfriend lives. To me, this place is great. I've never had a problem with the staff... so whoever says the staff is rude doesn't know what they're talking about. They work for the Connor Group, so it's not like they're the ones swindling you. Just grin and bear it, folks. When I first moved in, all problems I needed addressed were addressed in a timely manner. I have yet to deal with noisy neighbors or security issues. Let's hope it stays that way. For now, the rent is average (especially for the 2 and larger 3 bedroom), the staff is great, the convenience factor is amazing, but the water bill sucks balls.

Resident
2010 - 2011 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/26/2011
This is an OK place to live. Good Things: Grounds are well kept, Apartments are new, Tennis courts, Good maintenance response. Good location for me. Bad Things: If you go to renew your lease, the increases put the apartment FAR ABOVE market value to the point where you might consider moving out and moving back in. Even with all those fees, you could come out ahead. In fact, I told them I wanted to move out of my apartment and move back in. They said the rental price on my apartment for a new tenant would be more than their renewal rate for me yet ALL OTHER apartments of the size were going for less for new tenants. So, I suggested I move out and move back into a different apartment of the same size to get the lower rate. They were ready to proceed with that type of ridiculousness. The property manager claimed to have no power over this. I called Connor repeatedly but never heard back. At a certain point I just folded, I couldn't deal with the hassle of moving. Meanwhile, they've got Mickey Mouse on the corner saying "Great Deals" which says to me that they're hurting. I just don't understand the economics of how this works. Make sure you add an extra $75 per month for Heartland Fees. You'll pay a sanitation fee for a really messy, smelly garbage area. Also, if you conserve water, don't expect to see savings. The way the water charge is structured you're not paying for what you use - it's more of an average. And, you'll find out about the Heartland fees when you sit down to sign your lease. I almost backed out over that but I just didn't have any more time or energy to apartment hunt. I haven't had security issues yet I see no effort to keep non-residents off the property, in the pool area in particular.

2010 - 2011 Not Recommended Reviewed 03/18/2011
DO NOT MOVE IN TO THIS SHADY PLACE. I got a prom rate when I signed the contract before I moved in last August, and then I got a phone call saying that the sales representative gave me a prom rate that was not allowed, and they would have to raise the rent. I had to fight with them over this for many days as I signed it on the dotted line so as the property manager. After I moved in over a month, it was finally resolved. This is the first strike. The second strike is that I found out my utility bill was EXTREMELY high. I am just talking about the water bill, sewage fees and trash fees cuz it goes over $100 each month. Let me give you a breakdown of the bill I receive. Trash charge: 19.88, Pest control charge: 8.99, stormwater (what the heck is this): 9.99, sanitation fee 12.99, recycle admin fee: 3.99, service fee/water base charge: 5.86. These are the fixed fees you have to pay each month which comes out $61.7 even before you use any water or sewage!!! The third strike is that the move-out notice is 60 days here instead of 30 days and the office would not provide any notification to you. So you need to remember that you need to go in office 2 months prior your move-out date, otherwise you would be charged for $200 any additional days from the date 60days you notified them. I was late for 2 days and I ended up paying $200 late fee 2 days of market per rate for that price. The maintenance here is not that great. My bathroom leaks water from the third floor and they came once but did nothing. So think twice before you move cuz the management just tries to get your money by all means!!! One more thing, you will have to pay utility bill even before your move-in date if you move in in the middle of their billing cycle. I ended up paying $60 something right after I moved in on August 16th for the 15 days of august I was not even here. So if you do your math, that adds up to your monthly rent by roughly $100 bucks if you rent a 2br/2bath place by yourself or $50 for each person. So, be aware if you do decide to move in about all the hidden costs they do not tell you!!! Oh they changed the management team and the new team is horrible.

Resident
2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/19/2011
I have lived at Lenox for almost two years and I think it is a great apartment complex. The only issue I ever had was when the management changed from Equity to the Connor Group. The transition was not as smooth as it could have been and I felt like the residents were kind of left out of the loop. It also seemed like the new management team was kind of unresponsive when they first took over. It's definitely better now and has even been renovated. The water provider changed with the sale, so now my water bill has tripled because of high fees for things like pest control, recycling, sewage, trash, and more. They claimed that the high fees would help the trash and recycling to be taken out more frequently, but the trash and recycling still piles up. There is a constant change in leasing agents which prevents them from getting to know their tenants, as they should. As a result, I never know who to hand my rent checks to because I have no idea if they work in the office or not. I m not as satisfied with the Connor group as I was with Equity. Other than that, I do it's in the perfect location. There is easy access to the highway and many stores and restaurants.

Resident
2009 - 2011 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/18/2011
I would not recommend this apartment community for three primary reasons. First, the extra fees the property charges (for trash, recycling, pest control and storm water runoff) are exorbitant, particularly if you have one of the smaller apartments. Second, they are misleading as to residents' rights under NC law. If they threaten you with high late fees (more than 5% of your rent) or take any action which seems unfair, I would suggest getting a lawyer. Finally, the management and staff of the leasing office are unprofessional. Do not expect them to return your calls. Do not expect them to follow up on issues which you would like addressed, whether it be a late payment, noise complaints, or referral payment.

Resident
2007 - 2010 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/26/2010
I have lived here for a few years and the place was very well run by Equity Residential; the Equity staff were more pleasant and prompt in solving maintenance problems. Some old hands were willing to go out of their way to solve problems and provide small conveniences like replacing damaged equipment free of cost. The new management is absolutely horrible. The Connor group bought the property from Equity, and this has resulted in an immediate change in atmosphere and comfort. 1. The first change was an intermediary company called Heartland Regional Power Co. in Ohio that took over the water bill. Turns out Heartland is owned by the Connor Group as well. So why pay the same company through two different bills (rent and water); well the reason becomes clear when resigning the lease. The Connor group invited current residents 3-4 months in advance of lease expiry promising special advance deals. When you show up, they adopt a more threatening tone; either sign the lease now, or give a 60 day notice. Essentially you go assuming you will discuss the new terms, but soon you realize they are actually threating you with eviction unless you agree to their exorbitant rate hikes. They also bad mouth Equity residential for providing good service (imagine that!!); saying the reason the property was being sold was because of the good quality service Equity provided that Connor now can't afford without additional charges. 2. The Heartland Regional Power co. now charges us for not only water, but also pest control, trash, and recycling. The reason you pay two bills is now clear; they can impose additional charges (a minimum of 50 dollars), without inflating the base rent amount. This is a downright scam and they want to squeeze every last thieving dollar out of the tenants. Of course, they don't tell you all this while signing the contract. They charge monthly for pest control, even though it is only provided on request, and only once every three months. They charge for recycling when Equity did not; and the charge for trash is now much higher than before. Quite simply, this is a scam company, and I can't wait to get out. THEY EVEN CHARGE $10 FOR SOMETHING CALLED STORM WATER! 3. It's not over yet; the Heartland Regional power co. sends you a separate bill for which you have to pay a convenience fee of $3 if you want to pay by credit card online, or over the phone. Don't think of paying by check- if you miss the payment day by a date, you get a call from a collections company! Horrible, horrible! The customer service is downright rude, and they have no time to answer questions. All of this for the Connor group to inconvenience and nickle and dime their customers. Think about it- why can't the property accept these payments if it is the same parent company? Only to profit from any late payments customers may make on their separate utility bills. Also think of it- why pay a company in Ohio for maintenance and services provided in North Carolina? 4. Ain't over still. The new management is rude and incompetent, and the new staff don't have any idea of how to provide pleasant service. Obviously they pay their staff less than Equity would have, and they are willing to compromise on the quality of their staff. The manager Chris is the most horrible apartment manager I have come across in all my 13-14 years of renting apartments. What a terrible experience it has been- I can't express that in words. I will watch out for the Connor Group, and stay away. I will also warn everyone I know to avoid properties run by this company. Please do not rent an apartment at Lenox at Patterson Place if you have a choice- you will be rewarding incompetence and dishonest business practices.

Strange. *Our neighbors are passive-aggressive, immature pricks. Instead of asking us to quiet down (which would require actual human interaction), they submit noise complaints and write on apartment review sites. It's time to grow up. Other than that, it's not a bad place to live.

2007 - 2010 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/20/2010
This place WAS a great place to live, then the complex was sold to new ownership this Fall and they replaced all the staff. The new staff are completely inadequate. If you are a resident and need help in the office, forget about getting help if there is anyone else there. They are often understaffed at peak times and you can wait 20 or 30 minutes just to get help. The transfer of our water bill to a new company went about as smoothly as a kidney stone. They sent out a letter explaining the water bill, one of the first communications with residents by the management, that was about as friendly as an eviction notice. The grounds are falling into disrepair very quickly. The trash is worse than ever, near the dumpster, mailboxes, tennis courts, etc. The fountain by the office has not been working since they took over, the pool is filthy. (Yes, it is winter as I write this, but the old staff used to maintain the pool and make sure it was clean and the chemicals were balanced, even when it got cold.) The warning signs are there, this place will continue to fall into disrepair and the customer service will be terrible unless they make a major change soon. I would NOT recommend moving here, you have been warned.

Resident
2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/17/2008
I moved into Lexon in Mid-August. I have had nothing but the nicest experience. I moved here from Indiana and had never been to the complex prior to signing the lease, which made a little nervous. However, the pictures that they sent were exactly what I was moving into. The apartment was clean and no maintenance was needed at move-in. I've had to use the maintenance staff twice. One for a hairball in the sink and once to fix the toilet seat. For the hairball, I mentioned it to the office staff and maintenance was there the next to take care of it. The second time I used the online form and maintenance was there the same day to take care of it. I've always felt safe in the complex. When I go get my mail, I see other residents walking their dogs, taking their kids for walks, etc... Having moved here from Indiana and unsure of the area, the office staff has helped give me directions to area attractions, places to eat, running trails. They have helped make the transition a smooth one.

Resident
2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/26/2008
We have been nothing but disappointed with Lenox @ PP. There is an excuse for everything. July 4 weekend, no gas in the grills on the grounds, no briquetts in the grills at the pool. When I complained I was told that the grills on the grounds are broken and will be replaced but not until 2009. The manager suggested I buy a grill! We've cooked on the ones by the tennis courts earlier in the summer and had no problem. This weekend we disconnected the tank and took it to Tru-Value, spent our own $20 to refill the tank, reconnected it and it works fine. There are drinking fountains near the tennis courts but they are turned off. I was told it was due to water restrictions, but after checking with the City of Durham, drinking fountains were never restricted. I've asked for a trash can near the grills at the tennis courts, we pick up the trash every weekend ourselves. Management said they can't put a trash can there because people put their trash in it and maintenance has to empty the cans everyday. OK, residents should take their household trash to the dumpster, but we can't have a trash can because of this? Shouldn't part of maintenance be to empty the ground's trashcans daily anyway? There's also a spectator's area at the tennis courts that is not kept up. Nails sticking up, boards coming loose, wasps nests, etc. Everything at the office area and front entrance is kept up nicely, but drive around, the back apartments are not landscaped, the pinestaw is old or non existent. We have drainage problems at our building, everything is sloped toward the building so when it rains all the water collects on the sidewalk and the apartment patio (hasn't come in the apt. yet, but I'm waiting for that). The trash dump area falling apart. Once inside our apartment, we're fine, but if you're looking to use any of the "amenities", go somewhere else.

I've noticed them, too and have mentioned it to the management. We'll see how that turns out. Resident
2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/31/2008
I looked at a lot of places in the Chapel Hill area before settling on Lenox at Patterson Place. I have a corner apartment on the top floor and the apartment is very quiet. I very rarely hear my downstairs neighbor or the girl I share my bedroom wall with. The apartment is also very clean and it looks new. The major problem that I have with this place is that the trash bins & mailboxes are all the way on the other side of the apartment complex. So essentially, unless you want to lug your trash half a mile, you have to take it over by car. The fitness center is also pretty small, cramped and dirty. I'm not sure how frequently it's cleaned. The other bit of advice I can offer is that if you're planning on getting a studio apartment, be sure to see it in person first because the pictures that the leasing agent sends you exaggerates the size of the apartment.

There is an all student apartment complex next to it, however, and at night you get people from their walking around and making noise on that side of the complex.<br><br>The pool is nice (although really shallow! only 3 feet) as is the exercise room and business center. You get wireless internet throughout the clubhouse and even at the pool.<br><br>Overall, I recommend this as a good place to live.

Resident
2003 - 2006 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/04/2006
i have lived here for about three years. the complex is typically very quiet, lots of families and young professionals. i am in a second story one bedroom with people above and below-i've never heard the apartment underneath mine. the upstairs tenants i can hear occassionally if they walk loudly, but a few bangs on the ceiling with a broom usually solves the problem, and is a lot easier than whining to management. the apartments have new appliances, nice carpet and crown molding. they allow pets of all sizes which is great, although i have seen numerous tenants ignore the leash laws, but that is due to their own irresponsibility. pool is pretty but only 3 feet deep, good for toddlers i guess. nice laundry room, well maintained grounds. management can be disorganized about leaving notices, etc., but as long as you are clear and stand your ground they usually admit their mistakes. the rent has been raised considerably since i've lived here, they don't offer any great deals upon signing a new lease, although i did get a good price when i moved in. as with any complex there have been car break-ins and such, but it doesn't happen frequently. overall, this place feels safe-i can walk my dog at night without being afraid. good apartments, good community.

I come home from walking the dog and go to work. Come home, cook dinner, and relax watching TV, read, play tennis, swim, or exercise at the numerous communities amenities. I lived in Alta Crest for one year, and overall found the property to be adequate. However, there have been a rash of car break-ins this summer, and I would recommend that you keep nothing of value in your car. If you have an expensive stereo with a detachable face, bring it with you to your apartment. I was disheartened by the office's unwillingness to caution residents of the potential danger.<br>Aside from the break-ins, the property is attractive, and maintenance is prompt. We have had an ant problem during the summer months. Some members of the office staff are unpleasant (I chuckled when I read the review which described the property manager as "conniving" - don't work with her if you cn avoid it!), but others are cheerful.<br>Overall, it's not a bad value, but be aware of the potential for theft.

2004 - 2005 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/20/2005
My husband (a grad student), me and our 2 little boys lived here for one year (2004-2005) and really enjoyed our neighbors, the nice swimming pool and the very friendly staff. We had some maintenance problems but all were taken care of promptly. There was very rarely loud noise or disturbances, except for a few neighborhood children who like to play in the parking lot. There is a small playground that could be added on to, but it is kept nice nonetheless. There is a free car washing facility on the property that is very useful. The location can't be beat- feels private but is minutes from Durham, Chapel Hill, I-40 and everything in between. All major shopping is within 5 minutes. Nice sidewalks for walking around the neighborhood and a nice mix of ages of people live here.

2003 - 2004 Not Recommended Reviewed 11/21/2004
I would not recommend this community when there are much nicer communities so close (Evergreens, Deerfield, etc). I rented a 2 bedroom apartment which had adequate space inside and the car wash station was a nice touch. <br>Other than that, the "balcony" served more as a window... You have about a foot of space there. If 2 people wanted to come outside, the first would have to get situated then the other could come out and not have room to turn around to close the door!! <br>Maintenance was friendly, but took so many trips in and out of the apartment whenever anything needed fixing. I called at least three times for electrical issues and leaks. The leak issue went unresolved for months and I moved out before the wall was ever patched. <br>The staff.... well the manager always seemed unapproachable but the leasing agents (3 I met in my time there) were smiling and courteous.<br>Breed restrictions on animals. If you have a dog that doesnt meet their restrictions, again ... consider Deerfield.<br>Car break-ins were not uncommon, but that happens in Durham. I cannot fault the Management for that. The parking areas are well-lit so really, theives are everywhere looking for vulnerability. Keep your car empty of anything valuable. <br>Pool was nice and BBQ stations were convenient to the pool and individual apartments. <br>My favorite part of the apartment was the kitchen. The white cabinets and appliances made decorating easy. The countertop and flooring choices available for certain apartments were nice. <br>My electric bill was about $120 a month... so I question the "energy saving" stuff I read about before I moved in.<br>Generally quiet community. Oh, I have recently lived in a complex that allowed school buses to drive past all the buildings... very annoying back-up alarms early in the AM. Alta Crest has a bus stop outside the community, close for the kids, but far enough away there is no noise for the people trying to sleep.<br>Hope that this is helpful.

2002 - 2004 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/24/2004
After living in other complexes in Durham, Alta Crest is by far the best. The rent is very reasonable for what you get in return. The apartments are relatively new, modern, spacious, and maintained very well. Parking is excellent and the staff couldn´t be more pleasant and accommodating. Any maintenance request has been handled within 24 hours, and at times immediately. Often the leasing office provides raffles for rent reductions and activities for residents. The pool area is beautiful, never crowded, and an excellent location for BBQ´s. Overall pretty safe - police officers live in the complex and patrol periodically. Very close to shopping centers and I-40 and only minutes from Duke University and UNC Chapel Hill. Perfect for families and students. I would highly recommend this apartment complex to anyone!

I never lived in Alta Crest, but I was interested in moving there. I had read from previous posters to beware of "the special." They were right. When I asked what the special was they quoted me a price higher than what is listed on rent.com. When I asked them why the special was higher than the usual price they told me that the price is actually $200 higher than what is on the website and that the website price is only for instant move in. I felt like they were trying to trick me into thinking that I was getting a good price when I was not even getting their usual price. Tha apartments look great, but I can not stand tricky sales people.

Resident
2002 - 2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/14/2003
Overall, a good place to live, but quite overpriced. When I moved in, I got my 1 bedroom apartment "on special" for $550 ("Market rate" = $750). I was a little nervous about the potential big jump in rent at the end of the lease, but was assured (verbally, of course, not in writing, stupid me!) that "Oh, they know you´ll just move if they raise the rent back to market rate, so I´m sure they´ll give you a discount again when it´s time to renew your lease." Well, when it came time to renew, they did give me a discount, but my rent still went up to $700/month. I don´t know how they expect anyone to budget a $150/month rent increase! I even went to talk to them about it, and their attitude was "too bad." So I´m moving. And also, I was one of those people mentioned by a previous poster who had my car broken into along with many others on the same night. I didn´t bother to replace my (expensive) stereo and just put the factory model back in. I´m glad I did because since mine was stolen, I´ve gotten several notices saying there have been nights with mutiple break-ins as again. So beware!

Report
Resident
2001 Recommended Property Reviewed 12/20/2002
This was my second apartment. The landscaping is beautiful, and they make sure it stays that way. I lived in a 3 bdrm with 2 other roommates. My biggest gripe was with construction. The walls are very thin and the apartment was very small considering what we paid for it. The plumbing was the worst. EACH time I used the toilets, I had to flush twice. We had to space our showers hours apart. Don´t try to take a bath b/c the water won´t stay hot enough to fill the tub. If more than one person needs to shower in the morning, one of them will have to take a cold shower. I had anoher gripe with parking. Our entire building was 3 bedroom apartments and each apartment on only allowed 2 spaces. Needless to say, I´ve had to park at other buildings many days. The lots are well lit and this may not be a problem with one and two bedrooms. I think these apartments are great to live in right now but once the appliances age, it won´t be worth living in.

Resident
2001 - 2002 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/19/2002
We´ve been living here since August. The staff is incredibly friendly. The apartments are nice and in good condition. The grounds are beautifully kept, and maintainance usually comes the same day anything needs to be fixed (clogged toilets, etc.) The layout of the apartments are very nice. The only complaints we have are the size of the porches (basically non-existant), and the equipment in the gym. While the fitness center provides 2 treadmills, 2 stationary bikes, stairstepper, small dumbbells, and a universal system, it´s a small space for everything in there. <br> <br>Overall, I like living in Alta Crest and would recommend it!
